page.title: 02Smuggling
page.content: At the beginning of the last century and earlier this stretch of coast was nortorious for shipwrecks,wrecking and smuggling.In the latter case,smugglers landed kegs of brandy from Barfleur,in France,at the chines and carried them inland to Compton,Mottistone, Brighstone,Shorwell and Chale.One well trodden smuggler's route inland to {Brighstone}was from{Atherfield through {Sutton and Thorncross,emerging at the {top of Mead Lane.}Ships wrecked on this coast may be numbered in hundreds During England's naval engagement against the Spanish Armada,in which the island was the enemy's prime target for invasion,a Spanish galleon was wrecked in Chale Bay and much later gold coins from it's cargo were found on the beach. { }
